Name: Stela of Tany
Description: The stela is broken into two pieces: the lunette and decorated section are in Vienna, the long inscription is in the Cairo Museum.The Vienna piece has a lunette with a winged sun disc and the usual adoration scene of the Late Period: the deceased is standing in front of an offering table, Osiris, Harendotes and Isis. The vertical lines of inscription mention the three gods and Tany. She is pouring liquid from a hes-vase over an offering table with loaves. Osiris is standing on a low pedestal, Harendotes and Isis are standing behind him, each holding a was-sceptre in their left hand. Only traces of the first line of the inscription are left on this piece in Vienna.
